bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Edmund Yates, 7 May 1873
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: Pardon me for my forgetfulness about the pictures. I send you three, to make it up. I have been putting off every thing—forgetting every thing—till I feel well again—for I am still in a pretty bad way—but shall come round again by-and-by, with the blessing of God—And so, (as Mr. Philp's messenger is waiting) I shake hands across—& abruptly bid you good bye, for this time.

postscript.p: My address here is Solicitor's Office, Treasury, and shall always be happy to hear from you.
